name: PlayStation 3 Update File
summary: Learn about .PUP files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: You can choose to update the PS3 console by downloading the PUP file from the Internet directly to the console. You can also download the PUP file from the Internet to your computer, then transfer the update file using storage media, such as a hard disk or USB storage device.

When transferring the PUP file from a storage device to the PS3, save it in the /​PS3/​UPDATE folder. To update the PS3, select Settings → System Update in the console, then press the "X" button on the controller to begin the update process.
NOTE: To extract the contents of a PUP file in Windows, use the PS3 PUP Extractor program.

description: A Linux PUP file is an installation package used by Puppy Linux operating system. It executes as an installer and starts installing the package files. On Linux, it is often referred to as DotPup file and is similar to the .exe and .msi installer files used on Windows OS. The newer versions of Puppy Linux use .pet file format instead of the PUP file format.

A PUP file is a file or patch used to update the PlayStation 3 (PS3) system software. It may include security patches, bug fixes, and extra operating system features. PUP files are typically named PS3UPDAT.PUP.
